result.execSummary:
The defendant Javin M Vogel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MA] Cases 16CM172 called at 1:03pm 
Defendant Javin M Vogel in court, in custody with Attorney Ramneek S Button.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 16CM172, Sentencing After Revocation occurs:
--Counsel verify receipt of Revocation packet; prepared to proceed with sentencing
--sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith; to be served concurrent with any child support commitment so long as already being served. 
The Court authorizes transfer of this sentence to Dodge County, so long as it is without electronic monitoring, and is served as would be in Jefferson County.
--91 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Vogel is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence  with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

The Court converts any outstanding costs/fees to civil judgment

recess: 1:17pm
**************************************

[MK] case called at 2:17pm. 
Defendant Javin M Vogel in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 1.

On Count # 2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Vogel on Probation for one year, with conditions:

--to undergo a criminal thinking course as directed by the Agent
--no contact with Anthony Williams
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drug
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--to submit a DNA sample upon demand
--to pay costs , fees, surcharges

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess 2:28pm

to Appear

Case recalled at 2:31 pm [Clerk SH]
Attorney Karl E Huebner in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Huebner submits authorization and informs the Court that he has spoken with Mr. Vogel. Mr. Vogel recalls that he was told that since he signed the authorization, he would not have to appear today. Do believe there was confusion as was not the original counsel appointed. Did not have ride arranged as he did not believe he needed to appear. Requests matter be set for PTC and STC and warrant be quashed. Plea has already been entered and willing to waive speedy trial at this time. 
ADA Beck presents no objection
Court continues bond as previously set and quashes warrant
Recess: 2:34 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 6/22/16 at 3:00 pm and (2) STC on 7/8/16 at 3:00 pm - Send notices

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 9:50am.
Defendant Javin M Vogel in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct.  He provides a new address:  N1635 Scofield Road, Watertown WI 53098.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $750  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
---no discussion of the facts of the case with Selena Soto or with Terry Lee Vogel Jr.
--no contact with Tony WIlliams 
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription drugs as prescribed

Ms. Selena Sota is present in court.  The Court clarifies to both Mr. Vogel and Ms. Soto that they are prohibited from discussions about this case whatsoever.
recess 9:58am 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/20/16 at 10:30am
